definition: permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)

sentences.english: Regular and consistent Worship is an integral part of Christian living.
sentences.chinese: 恆常和定期的崇拜是基督徒生活的一個重要組成部分。

sentences.english: This description of the surface spectral reflectance has the property of color constancy.
sentences.chinese: 該描述子具有顏色恆常的特性。

sentences.english: But circumstances are not always pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 但是人生境遇並非恆常如此。

sentences.english: Through patience a ruler can be persuaded, and a gentle tongue can break a bone.
sentences.chinese: 恆常忍耐可以勸動君王，柔和的舌頭能折斷骨頭。

definition: to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
